qas.question: What is the name of the newspaper with the most varied political support in British history?
Which political party is The Times columnist, Daniel Finkelstein, associated with?
Which political party is The Times columnist, David Aaronovitch, associated with?

context: This makes it the most varied newspaper in terms of political support in British history. Some columnists in <a0_0>The Times<a0_0/> are connected to the <a1_0>Conservative Party<a1_0/> such as Daniel Finkelstein, Tim Montgomerie, Matthew Parris and Matt Ridley, but there are also columnists connected to the <a2_0>Labour Party<a2_0/> such as David Aaronovitch, Phil Collins, Oliver Kamm and Jenni Russell.
